overview: From 2025-10-01 to 2025-11-01, elizaos/eliza had 22 new PRs (18 merged), 3 new issues, and 14 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Imports not found in index.ts with Eliza CLI 1.61
topIssues.author: matteo-brandolino
topIssues.body:
## Describe the bug
When creating a new project using `elizaos create`, some imports in `index.ts` fail:
Module '"@Elizaos/core"' has no exported member 'logger'.ts(2305) Module '"@Elizaos/core"' has no exported member 'IAgentRuntime'.ts(2305) Module '"@Elizaos/core"' has no exported member 'ProjectAgent'.ts(2305)
Copy code

## To Reproduce
1. Install Eliza CLI 1.61.  
2. Run `elizaos create` to generate a new project.  
3. Open `index.ts` and try to import `logger`, `IAgentRuntime`, or `ProjectAgent` from `@Elizaos/core`.  

## Expected behavior
These members should be correctly exported and importable from `@Elizaos/core` in a newly generated project.  

## Screenshots
<!-- Add screenshots if applicable -->

## Additional context
- Eliza CLI version: 1.61  
- This occurs immediately after project creation without any modifications.  
- Possible regression from previous versions of `@Elizaos/core`.

topPRs.title: feat(core): add MessageService interface and default implementation
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker

topPRs.title: feat: migrate to UUID-only agent identification
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Agents now use randomly generated UUIDs (not names) for identity; duplicate names are allowed, with loader/runtime/server/DB updated plus migrations and tests.
> 
> - **Core/runtime (`packages/core`)**:
>   - Generate `agentId` via `uuidv4()` (no name-derived IDs).
>   - `ensureAgentExists` now requires `agent.id`, updates/creates strictly by UUID.
>   - Logs/messages reference `agent.id`.
> - **Server (`packages/server`)**:
>   - Loader `jsonToCharacter` assigns `id` if missing and supports env prefixes by `name` and `id`.
>   - Agent CRUD create path uses provided `character.id` (no name-to-UUID), and updates active runtimes in-place.
>   - Added tests for loader UUID generation and CRUD behavior with duplicate names.
> - **SQL Plugin (`packages/plugin-sql`)**:
>   - Schema: drop unique constraint on `agents.name`.
>   - `createAgent` checks duplicate `id` only; allows duplicate `name`.
>   - Integration and migration tests verifying duplicate-name support, UUID-based CRUD, and constraint removal.
> - **CLI (`packages/cli`)**:
>   - Scenario factory assigns random `id` to test character (no name-based ID).
> - **Project starter**:
>   - Character docs note auto-generated `id` and option to set a fixed UUID.
> - **Tests**:
>   - Extensive suites across core/server/sql to ensure UUID independence from names and proper migrations.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 93f269089b99832050651406cf7047f4a9392463. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Agents/characters now use randomly generated UUIDs for identity; multiple agents can share the same name.
  - Loader auto-assigns an ID when missing; explicit IDs are preserved.
  - Environment variable prefixing now derives from the agent ID for consistent configuration.
- Documentation
  - Starter character docs updated to explain ID generation and how to set a fixed ID.
- Chores
  - Database schema updated to remove the unique constraint on agent names, enabling duplicate names while keeping ID-based operations.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat(core): add config and plugin modules - phase 4 - refactor ElizaOS/Server
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Added plugin management with auto-install, loading, validation, and dependency resolution.
  - Introduced configuration utilities: character parsing/validation/defaults, environment variable loading from .env, and secrets population from local env files.
  - Expanded public API to expose configuration and plugin modules.

- Tests
  - Added comprehensive test suites for plugin management, character config, environment loading, and secrets handling, including edge cases and dependency ordering.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: fix: code formatting standardization and const declaration fix
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses code quality improvements through formatting standardization and a variable declaration fix.

## Changes

### Code Formatting
- **Quote Standardization**: Converted double quotes to single quotes across all client-side components for consistency
- **Formatting Consistency**: Applied consistent code formatting to:
  - Agent Prism components (Avatar, Badge, Button, CollapseAndExpandControls, etc.)
  - Trace viewer and span card components
  - Chat components
  - Configuration files (tsconfig.json, lerna.json)

### Bug Fix
- **Schema Transformer** (`packages/plugin-sql/src/runtime-migrator/schema-transformer.ts`):
  - Changed `let result` to `const result` on line 128
  - The variable is never reassigned after initialization, making it a good candidate for `const`
  - This follows best practices for immutable variable declarations

### Other Improvements
- Improved code readability through better line breaks and indentation
- Applied consistent formatting to CLI tests and server API code
- Reduced overall line count from 1385 to 1124 (-261 lines) through more efficient formatting

## Impact

- **No Functional Changes**: All changes are formatting-related except for the const fix
- **Improved Code Quality**: More consistent codebase following project style guidelines
- **Better Type Safety**: Using `const` instead of `let` for immutable variables

## Testing

- All existing tests should pass as no functional logic was changed
- The const fix is a minor improvement that doesn't affect runtime behavior

## Files Changed (42 files)

### Core Components
- `packages/cli/src/commands/start/index.ts`
- `packages/cli/tests/commands/dev.test.ts`
- `packages/cli/tests/commands/start.test.ts`

### Client Components (Agent Prism)
- 30+ component files in `packages/client/src/components/agent-prism/`
- Utility files: `agent-prism-utils.ts`, `eliza-span-adapter.ts`

### Plugin & Server
- `packages/plugin-sql/src/runtime-migrator/schema-transformer.ts`
- `packages/server/src/api/agents/runs.ts`

### Configuration
- `lerna.json`
- `tsconfig.json`

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Standardizes quotes/formatting across the client UI, tests, and configs, and replaces a let with const in the SQL schema transformer.
> 
> - **Client (agent-prism UI)**:
>   - Quote/style normalization and minor formatting across `packages/client/src/components/agent-prism/**` (no logic changes).
>   - Trace viewer, span card, tabs, and utilities (`agent-prism-utils.ts`, `eliza-span-adapter.ts`) reformatted.
> - **CLI Tests**:
>   - Formatting/line-wrap adjustments in `packages/cli/tests/commands/{dev,start}.test.ts`.
> - **Server**:
>   - Minor log string formatting in `packages/server/src/api/agents/runs.ts`.
> - **Plugin SQL**:
>   - In `packages/plugin-sql/src/runtime-migrator/schema-transformer.ts`, replace `let result` with `const result`.
> - **Config**:
>   - Compact arrays/formatting in `lerna.json` and `tsconfig.json`.
> - **Other**:
>   - Minor non-functional formatting in `packages/client/src/components/chat.tsx` and `agent-runs/AgentRunTimeline.tsx`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit fc94a1ce795f68129069b0ac6e0a2ca9eb94906b. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: feat: bump deps
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
bumps le' deps, :pogchamp:

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Updates dependencies across `packages/*` and root, including major tooling and runtime bumps (TypeScript, ESLint, Vite, Puppeteer, dotenv, langchain, uuid, Sentry, and more).
> 
> - **Root**:
>   - Bump `@types/node`, `@types/uuid`, `lerna`.
> - **packages/cli**:
>   - Upgrade runtime deps: `@anthropic-ai/claude-code`, `@anthropic-ai/sdk`, `@elizaos/plugin-openai`, `dotenv`, `globby`, `ora`, `type-fest`.
>   - Dev tooling: `cross-env`, `prettier`, `puppeteer`, `typescript`, `vite`.
> - **packages/client**:
>   - UI/runtime: `@react-spring/web`, `lucide-react`, `react-resizable-panels`, `tailwind-merge`.
>   - Testing/build: `@cypress/vite-dev-server`, `@testing-library/react`, `cypress`, `globals`, `jsdom`, `rollup-plugin-visualizer`, `vite`, `typescript` and `typescript-eslint`, `@vitejs/plugin-react-swc`, `eslint-import-resolver-typescript`.
>   - Types: `@types/react`.
> - **packages/core**:
>   - Runtime: `dotenv`, `langchain`, `uuid`.
>   - Dev tooling: `@types/uuid`, `prettier`, `typescript`.
> - **packages/server**:
>   - Runtime: `@sentry/node`, `@types/multer`, `dotenv`, `express-rate-limit`.
>   - Dev tooling: `prettier`, `tsx`, `which`.
> - **packages/api-client**:
>   - Dev tooling: `eslint`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 2523cc679c7a38ea7da4ad13b38a62e714965cd7. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topContributors.summary: standujar: Focused on significant refactoring of core components, introducing a new `mentionContext` interface in `elizaos/eliza#6030` which simplified the codebase (+520/-681 lines) and improved response logic. This core change was then propagated to dependent plugins like in `elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord#19`. They also fixed a bug in `elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter#15` related to AI SDK v5 tool results extraction. Their activity shows a primary focus on refactoring, bug fixes, and widespread configuration updates.

wtfsayo: This month, wtfsayo focused on improving code health and repository maintenance, executing a significant code standardization and formatting refactor in elizaos/eliza#6027 (+1124/-1385 lines). They also removed obsolete development files in elizaos/eliza#6026 and expanded the plugin ecosystem by adding a new relay plugin to the registry in elizaos-plugins/registry#234. Their work shows a primary focus on bugfixes and other maintenance, touching mostly code and configuration files.

0xbbjoker: This month, 0xbbjoker focused on enhancing plugin functionality and improving code maintainability within the `elizaos/eliza` repository. They delivered a key feature by adding an offset parameter for memory retrieval in the SQL plugin (elizaos/eliza#6032), a substantial change of +516/-209 lines. Additionally, they improved codebase health by removing 289 lines of unused code in a separate refactoring effort (elizaos/eliza#6029). Their work shows a dual focus on feature development and code quality, and they also supported the team through code review and comments.

odilitime: This month, odilitime's contributions were focused on supporting the team through code review. They completed 3 reviews, approving 2 and requesting changes on 1, and left 3 comments on pull requests.

matteo-brandolino: This month, matteo-brandolino focused on identifying and reporting issues within the Eliza ecosystem. They opened a bug report concerning the Eliza CLI where imports were not being found (elizaos/eliza#6031) and contributed to discussions by commenting on two issues.
